JUDGES: Aleš Pejchal;Angelika Nußberger;Ann Power-Forde;Ganna Yudkivska;Helena Jäderblom;Mark Villiger
TEXT: The applicant , Mr PERSON , is a NORP national , who was born in DATE and lives in FAC . He is represented before ORG by Odvetniška Družba Matoz D.O.O. , a law firm practising in PERSON .
ORG ( “ the Government ” ) are represented by their Agent , PERSON .
The facts of the case , as submitted by the parties , may be summarised as follows .
The applicant was serving a sentence in the closed section of Dob Prison from DATE until DATE .

As regards the facilities available to the applicant in the cells and common areas , as well as the health care regime in the prison , the conditions imposed on the applicant regarding activities outside the cells and contact with the outside world in general , see the ORG ’s decision in the case of PERSON and PERSON v. GPE ( dec . ) , nos . CARDINAL , CARDINAL/CARDINAL , CARDINAL , ORG , CARDINAL/CARDINAL , ORG , CARDINAL , ORG , CARDINAL/CARDINAL and DATE .

From DATE to CARDINAL DATE and from DATE to CARDINAL DATE the applicant was held in a cell no CARDINAL , ORG which measured QUANTITY and held CARDINAL inmates ( QUANTITY of personal space available to each inmate ) . He was later transferred several times . From DATE to DATE he was held in a cell no CARDINAL , Block CARDINAL which measured QUANTITY and held CARDINAL inmates ( QUANTITY of personal space available to each inmate ) . From DATE to CARDINAL DATE he was held in a cell no CARDINAL/CARDINAL , ORG which measured QUANTITY and held CARDINAL inmates ( QUANTITY of personal space available to each inmate ) . From DATE to CARDINAL DATE he was in a single cell which measured CARDINAL to QUANTITY .

According to the ORG ’s submissions dated DATE the applicant sustained injuries in CARDINAL physical conflicts with another prisoner on DATE and DATE . Due to injuries suffered on DATE he was hospitalised for DATE . In connection to this incident the applicant was found guilty of a serious disciplinary offence . After his appeal , where he stated that the tension with the other prisoner was calmed down with assistance of prison staff , ORG found that the conflict could have been prevented or avoided if the applicant behaved appropriately . Further , according to a doctor ’s report dated CARDINAL DATE the applicant was treated on CARDINAL occasions for different medical problems and was regularly treated by a psychiatrist . According to the Government ’s submissions dated DATE the applicant visited a doctor on CARDINAL occasions for treatment of his leg injury . As regards his allegations about an injury sustained on DATE , there is no note on it in his medical file . As regards his physical conflicts on DATE and DATE , the Government submitted that the applicant had played an active part in those fights . The applicant also never complained to the prison authorities about any conflict situation , neither did he ask to be transferred to another cell or prison .

For the relevant domestic law and practice , see paragraphs CARDINAL and CARDINAL - CARDINAL of the ORG ’s judgment in the case of ORG and Others v. GPE ( nos . CARDINAL/CARDINAL , CARDINAL/CARDINAL and CARDINAL , CARDINAL DATE ) , and paragraphs CARDINAL of ORG and PERSON GPE ( nos .
